intro: Fagara amapaensis, commonly known as the Amapa shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dark green, leathery leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
